p: Secondly, despite the decline in the national TB incidence in Zimbabwe, pockets of high TB transmission like Harare city will continue to propagate the disease at national level. Similar findings from metropolitan cities have attributed pockets of increased TB transmission, hotspots, to the continued generalized TB epidemics [ 14]. The mechanism of spread is believed to be increased social interaction as populations move in search of social services including health care [ 4, 35]. Identifying areas of increased TB transmission and plan interventions accordingly is critical for controlling the TB epidemic in Harare City. Also critical is the recognition of non-health sector developmental issues that may affect distribution TB disease.
